title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message:
Hi.

I have a 820-00165 with backlight flickering after liquid damage on and around LP85550. I have replaced LP8550 and all surrounding components.

BKL_EN - 2.78 V and up. Not steady.

BKL_PWM - 1.473v steady

PPHV_SOSW_LCDBKLT - 24V - 26V Fluctuates.

PP5V_S0 - 5V Steady

PP3V3_s0 - 3.3V Steady

Tried 2 LP8550's

Zero damage to LCD connector or surrounding area.

Thanks

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message:
Did you check XW7720?
Also check all LED return resistors.

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message: Tried known good screen as well as DC-in board/flex? BKLT_EN should be steady not up and down. Replaced both resistors? LED driver soldered properly?

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message:
If you make a short D-S on Q7706 (pins 1-6), do you get stable backlight?
If yes, check for corrosion arround Q7706/07 and R7788/89; possibly need to remove C7782.

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message:
Hello.

So far I tried 3 known good screens. 2 known good DC-IN boards and cables. All 6 LCD Return resistors are around 0 Ohm. Tried 3 lp8550's.

Put steady 3V on BKL_EN just in case. XW7720 is clean and not damaged at all. Continuity between pin 2 XW2770 and pin 2 D7701 strong.

Tried shorting pin 1 - 6  Q7706. Did blanket replacement on both lp8550 area and L7701 area,

Thanks

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message: Jeez what a mess that sounds awful. Maybe corrosion under the SMC messing with SMC_LID signal?

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message: Post diode mode to ground on ALL connections of U7701.

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message: Could very well be bad SMC messing with LID line if corroded originally. Try a new one to rule that out.

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message: Gotcha, will do. Thanks.

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message: Backlight still flickers?

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message:
Hi!

Replaced SMC with same issues present.

Pads (34)NC_BDV_BKL_PWM and (96) were damaged. But they are (NC) so I am assuming that they are not connected.

Thanks!

[url]https://photos.app.goo.gl/R4Xv8FoQTamV8Pji7[/url]

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message:
SMC is not involved in backlight flickering.
Unless SMC_LID is not stable.

Do you note the same flickers with low and high backlight level?
Did you try with known good LCD assembly?

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message: That just sounds downright awful at this point lol

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message:
[url]https://photos.app.goo.gl/rTQoENVAgCwB5WZy9[/url]

First link with original screen. Second link with entirely different display and body. 

Quality gets way worse with some theatre light effects at lower backlight level and actually completely turned off at one point. I have tried 3 different LP8550's so far so I dont think its that. Unless the entire strip that i have is bad, lol!

Yea [USER="1153"]JohnB8812[/USER] , this blows lol. I usually am closed on Monday but came in just for this... Awesome :cool:.

Thanks again!

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message:
Reflow LP8550 and gently tap it on top, to see it dancing a bit.
This will assure  all solders are good.
I had something like that with bad solders; got more flickers at low backlight level.

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message:
Hi.

Reflowed LP8550 and replaced with LP8550 from donor as well. Replaced LCD connector just in case even though there was zero damage.
No louck. Think Im gonna throw in the towel on this.

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message:
Do few PRAM reset before.
Also remove R7704 and run a wire from C7704 to R7715.
If still flickers, remove R7731 and run another wire from R7715 to C7711.
In this way you force both backlight controls to maxim.

title: 820-00165 backlight flickering
message:
OK.

Did 3 or 4 PRAM's.

Removed r7704, then connected c7704 and r7715. = Still flickers

Removed r7731, then connected r7715 and c7711. = No Backlight at all.

Thanks for sticking it out, lol.

[url]https://photos.app.goo.gl/5XeGEEpV4au6NzgHA[/url]
